titleStmt.title: Z. Dudley to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG13805

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; Folder 1865 Telegraphing, State Guards, Printing, Hospital, Office Expenses, Services Rendered; Right Stack

body.p: The bearer Ned Jones, a freed man of colour, I have known well for many years and hesitate not in saying, he is as reliable, honest and correct as any freeman in our, or any other City -- He informs me that he has presented a claim to your Excellency for damages done him by the Ky. Soldiers in burning the plank fencing and posts which enclosed his yard and garden -- I saw the soldiers myself takeing the plank off the fence and cutting down the posts for firewood, and admonished them for it, without avail --
I hope your Excellency will cause compensation to be made him on presenting proper vouchers for the same --

867
No 10
No. 12.
